B C D E G L M R T W

B

Board - Class in <Unnamed>
The Board class does much of the work here, keeping track of what pieces are where, and drawing the board on the screen.
Board() - Constructor for class Board
Builds a Board object, filling in the board array.

C

Chess - Class in <Unnamed>
 
Chess() - Constructor for class Chess
 
colLocations(Location, Location) - Static method in class Location
Given two Locations, on a column, returns an array of Locations between the two, NOT including start, and INCLUDING end.

D

diagLocations(Location, Location) - Static method in class Location
Given two Locations, on a diagonal, returns an array of Locations between the two, NOT including start, and INCLUDING end.

E

equals(Object) - Method in class Location
Determines if two Locations are equal.

G

getCol() - Method in class Location
Returns the col of the Location.
getColIndex() - Method in class Location
Returns the "computer science" equivalent of the col; in other words, instead of a-h, it returns 0-7.
getMove(Scanner) - Static method in class Chess
Used to get a move from the user, such as "b1 to c3".
getRow() - Method in class Location
Returns the row of the Location.
getRowIndex() - Method in class Location
Returns the "computer science" equivalent of the row; in other words, instead of 1-8, it returns 0-7.

L

Location - Class in <Unnamed>
A Location encodes a row and column on a Chess board.
Location(String) - Constructor for class Location
This constructor takes a String consisting of a char, followed by an int, like "a5".
Location(char, int) - Constructor for class Location
This constructor takes a char and an int, and creates a Location object out of it.
Location(int, int) - Constructor for class Location
This construct builds a Location from two array indices; in other words, given two ints 0-7, it builds a Location with the matching char (a-h) and int (1-8).

M

main(String[]) - Static method in class Chess
 
makeMove(String, String) - Method in class Board
This method should be called by the main method in Chess to make a move; YOU SHOULD COMPLETELY UNDERSTAND THIS METHOD BEFORE WRITING PIECE.JAVA.

R

rowLocations(Location, Location) - Static method in class Location
Given two Locations, on a row, returns an array of Locations between the two, NOT including start, and INCLUDING end.

T

toString() - Method in class Board
Provides the String of the board to be printed.
toString() - Method in class Location
Returns, for example, the String "a5"

W

whiteTurn() - Method in class Board
Returns whether or not it is white's turn, using the field whiteTurn
winner() - Method in class Board
Determines if the current board has a winner.
